NURISS Lifecare Pvt. Ltd. is a privately held Indian Pharmaceutical manufacturing company involved in manufacture and supply of wide range of avant-garde pharmaceuticals to semi-regulated and non regulated markets across the globe. Our commitment to provide world class quality, competitive pricing and a constant urge to explore new therapeutic segments and expand our product portfolio has gained us a reputation as a global manufacturer of medicines with world class quality products.

We are truly committed towards manufacture and supply of finest quality medication used for the treatment of various life threatening diseases and conditions. NURISS Lifecare Pvt. Ltd. has a robust product portfolio spread over major therapeutic areas particularly Cardiovascular Drugs, Anticancer Drugs, Anti-Retroviral, Antibiotics, Anti Tubercular Medication, Analgesics and Antipyretics and others.
Urnifer is a very good source of iron which improves haemoglobin and cures anaemia in women ,children and old age people.
Caluris is a very good source of calcium and its absorption is very fast . It also helps in growth of bone in children and growing population and it protects bone of Women and old age people.
It is good source of protein. It helps in growth and improvement in children ,women ,old age, working class, students and sick people.

A new study published in the journal Science finds that the human sense of smell can detect more than 1 trillion odors, far exceeding the number previous studies have indicated.
Vitamin D supplements: to take or not to take? | Click here

As well as hailing vitamin D supplements for their potential to reduce depression, past research has suggested they can improve breast cancer survival rates, as well as reduce the risk of heart attack.
Non-drinkers versus occasional drinkers | Click here

The study classes occasional drinkers as people "who had consumed alcohol in the past year but reported zero servings in an average week." People who had not consumed alcohol in the past year were categorized as non-drinkers.
Sense of smell is more complicated to study | Click here
For the study, Dr. Keller and colleagues invited volunteers to sniff vials of odors that held different mixes of 128 odor molecules responsible for scents ranging from spearmint to orange to anise.
